bibl.title: William McCow v. Territory of Washington. Complaint.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla |
In the matter of the application of William McCow for a writ of Habeas Corpus | Complaint and Petition
To the Honorable Samuel C Wingard Judge of the District Court for the First Judicial District of Washington Territory
William McCow yor petitioner and complainant herein shows to your Honor by this his complaint the following facts

1. That he is restrained of his liberty at Walla Walla City Washington Territory by George F. Thomas Sheriff of Walla Walla county W.T. and is now confined in the county Jail of said Walla Walla county
2. That the cause of said restraint is as follows

On the 20th day of November 1876 your petitioner was held to answer to the grand Jury for the on of
charge of assault with intent to murder by O P Lacy one of the Justices of the Peace for Walla Walla county W.T. and bail fixed at $1000.00 and in default of said bail was committed to jail. 3. Your petitioner shows that said bail is excessive that your petitioner is unable to give the sum.
4. That if said bail is reduced he will be enabled to give the sum.

Wherefore your complainant prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus be issued commanding the said George F. Thomas to provide before your Honor this petitioner, and that your Honor imagine into the cause of restraint of your petitioner and that he be admitted to bail.
Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla | ss

William McCow being first duly sworn says he is
petitioner above that the foregoing complaint and petition is true as he verily believes
Subscribed & sworn to before me this January 31, 1877
div1.ab: JD Saman Justice of the Peace
